metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11712 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: POST requests made by NPAPI plugins, such as Flash, that receive a status 308 redirect response can bypass CORS requirements. This can allow an attacker to perform Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.8, Firefox < 68, and Thunderbird < 60.8.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
